antichess
Class ControllerState

java.lang.Object
  antichess.ControllerState

public class ControllerState
extends Object

The ControllerState class handles communication between the ControllerMaster and the GameController class. The ControllerMaster changes values in a ControllerState object. The GameController then checks the ControllerState Object regularly to see what state it should be in. There should be only one GameController running per ControllerState object. When the ControllerState object is changed it notifies the GameController. Whenever the GameController is changing state it notifies the ControllerState.

The methods can be divided into three main categories: notifications, requests, views

  • Methods beginning with "set" are notifications. These are called by the currentController to notify the ControllerState of changes.
  • Methods beginning with "is" are views. They just return the current state.
  • Methods ending in "Game" are requests. They are called by external classes. They cause the currentController to enter these states.

States that the ControllerState will cause the GameController to enter:

Pause: The GameController is performing no actions relating to the game.

Stopped: The thread running the currentGameController is terminated, ending the game

Author:
nlharr
Specification Fields
  • state //Enum running, paused, stopped
  • requesting //Enum running, paused, stopped
  • currentGameController //GameController that this ControllerState is controlling
